intro: Pediomelum latestipulatum var. latestipulatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pediomelum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It is often found in coastal and inland regions with a Mediterranean climate. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance and drought tolerance.
